sections.heading: FALSE IMPRISONMENT DEFINED
sections.text:
18-2901. FALSE IMPRISONMENT DEFINED. False imprisonment is the unlawful violation of the personal liberty of another.

[18-2901, added 1972, ch. 336, sec. 1, p. 902.]

sections.heading: PUNISHMENT
sections.text:
18-2902. PUNISHMENT. False imprisonment is punishable by fine not exceeding $5000, or by imprisonment in the county jail not more than one (1) year, or both.

[18-2902, added 1972, ch. 336, sec. 1, p. 902.]
